decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressively and efficiently using a diverse range of colored creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Leyline of the Guildpact, the deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco provide strong creatures to beat down the opponent. Additionally, cards like Stubborn Denial and Teferi, Time Raveler offer disruption and protection, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy while controlling the tempo of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to consistently pressure your opponent. By combining these creatures with cards that provide additional damage or card advantage such as Mutagenic Growth and Expressive Iteration, this deck aims to establish early board dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game. The use of efficient spells like Lightning Bolt further enhances the deck's ability to deal damage and control the board, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently casting powerful creatures and spells, using cascade and other mechanics to keep the pressure on the opponent. It also includes some control elements like Leyline Binding and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements while still being able to cast spells efficiently. The inclusion of Quantum Riddler adds an element of randomness and unpredictability to the deck, keeping opponents on their toes. Overall, the deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and power.

The main idea of the deck is to play aggressively with a mix of creatures and spells that can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck focuses on using creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls along with spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to apply pressure early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and finishing power to help close out games quickly. The mana base is streamlined to ensure efficient casting of spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play Primeval Titan and trigger its abilities, particularly utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands. This enables the player to search for key utility lands such as Boseiju, Who Endures and Urza's Saga, as well as potentially win conditions like Scapeshift. The deck also includes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field to further accelerate mana production, creating a powerful combo engine that aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats and land interactions.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer. It leverages anthem effects with cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to pump up its creatures and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment allows for direct damage to finish off the opponent. The deck also has disruption elements with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while reducing the cost of your spells with Ruby Medallion. By casting multiple spells in a turn, you can trigger Ral, Monsoon Mage's abilities to deal damage to your opponent. Past in Flames allows you to replay your spells from your graveyard for more explosive turns. The goal is to combo off and finish the game with a big Grapeshot or strike your opponent down with Valakut Awakening. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the pieces needed for a powerful combo finish.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage. The deck also includes board wipes like Terminus and Prismatic Ending to help maintain board control. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional value by granting all creatures in the deck a buff. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents through efficient control and card advantage strategies.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It focuses on quickly building a board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way or deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to further boost the aggression of the deck. The overall strategy is to control the board and deal damage quickly to secure a win.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and efficient creature removal. By utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls alongside cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with damage. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional support and utility to maintain pressure on opponents. Additionally, the deck features cards like Blood Moon and Dalkovan Encampment to disrupt opponents' mana bases and gain an advantage.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to overwhelm opponents quickly. The deck also includes cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer for card advantage and board control. With a mix of efficient creatures and removal spells, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out games swiftly. Additionally, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and potential for explosive finishes.

The deck focuses on using combo cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to generate mana and deal massive damage to the opponent. It also includes a variety of control cards like Counterspell and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The deck doesn't rely on traditional lands for mana production, instead using cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Sea Gate Restoration for card advantage. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan with control spells.

This deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It also has ways to protect its creatures and gain card advantage with cards like Solitude and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent, while also having the ability to close out games quickly with its aggressive threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as control spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator is also utilized to search for specific artifacts to further control the board and push the deck towards victory.

This Modern aggro-affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and synergy, as well as powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga for ramp and additional threats, this deck looks to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game swiftly. With a mix of utility spells and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, this deck aims to take control of the board and secure victory through efficient plays and explosive turns.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo of Elves that can generate massive amounts of mana with cards like Priest of Titania and Heritage Druid. This mana is then used to power out big creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Ezuri, Renegade Leader, allowing for devastating attacks. The deck also includes cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to help untap elves for more mana production. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Elves and pump them up for a game-ending attack.
